fields.summary: Deleting a volume that does not exist using euca-delete-volume does not return an error

comments.body: Starting investigation.  Will provide debugging output from Eucalyptus and AWS.

Confirmed.  Debugging information below:

*Eucalyptus debugging information*

Client.InvalidVolume.NotFound: The volume 'vol-98c716b9' does not exist.
com.amazon.aes.webservices.client.Jec2SoapFaultException: SOAP Fault[code=Client.InvalidVolume.NotFound, str='The volume 'vol-98c716b9' does not exist.']
	at com.amazon.aes.webservices.client.Jec2Impl.UnwrapException(Jec2Impl.java:334)
	at com.amazon.aes.webservices.client.Jec2Impl.deleteVolume(Jec2Impl.java:2724)
	at com.amazon.aes.webservices.client.cmd.DeleteVolume.invokeOnline(DeleteVolume.java:49)
	at com.amazon.aes.webservices.client.cmd.BaseCmd.invoke(BaseCmd.java:1037)
	at com.amazon.aes.webservices.client.cmd.DeleteVolume.main(DeleteVolume.java:59)
{code}

In 4.0 we get an error response but the error message is ugly and not to the point. (adding 40 to affects version and bumping priority to get eyes on it again)

Installed Packages
Name        : eucalyptus
Arch        : x86_64
Version     : 4.0.0
Release     : 0.0.838.20140407gitab90b6ae.el6

{code}
[root@c-35 ~]# euca-delete-volume vol-88888888
euca-delete-volume: error (InternalFailure): com.eucalyptus.util.async.FailedRequestException: Cluster response includes _return=false:DeleteVolumeResponseType:null:return=false:epoch=null:status=null
{code}
